From Trump to Weinstein, women united now have harassers’ numbers
Our company didn't start in a garage... we started in VR!
This is a profound moment in history. More and more companies will be started not in garages, like the powerhouses of Microsoft and Google, but they will be started in virtual reality.

I meet companies every week that have no office. We at Doghead Simulations are giving them the most cost effective solution to the traditional physical office and companies large and small all over the world are joining us every day. It is a wonderful time to be alive! =)

This #FinancialFeministFriday we’re recognizing soccer all-star and equal pay and LGBTQ activist, Abby Wambach. Since 2015, Abby has been instrumental in leading US women’s soccer’s fight for equal pay. Abby is a two-time Olympic gold medalist, World Cup champion, and record holder of most goals scored by any player, man or woman, in international competition (184 goals, nbd). But there’s one win she didn’t capture during her soccer career: closing the gender pay gap. This year, thanks to efforts made by many team members, the women’s soccer team signed a new contract that narrowed their gap, but they still earn less despite regularly outperforming the men’s team. (Sound familiar?) In retirement Abby continues to take on the gender pay gap — and not just in soccer. “I think when you’re stuck inside of it you don’t even know how unfairly you’re being treated. As any woman or a gay woman, you can’t have that feeling of you’re just going to take what you can get.” Abby may be retired, but she continues to work tirelessly on closing the gender pay gap. She’s an MVP in our book (and should be in yours too).

Creative Consultant + Inspirational Speaker + Award-Winning Author

Tania Katan,CEO of Creative Trespassing, is an award-winning author, creative consultant and keynote speaker who believes in storytelling at all costs.  As the former Brand Evangelist for Axosoft, she co-created the viral campaign #ItWasNeverADress. Katan empowers people and companies (like American Express, Humana, Expedia, Etsy, and more) to be a little unruly, color outside the lines, and disrupt the status quo in order to start a conversation. Katan is a whiz in disruptive branding, audience engagement, women empowerment campaigns, and radically activating spaces online and off. Her forthcoming book (Random House, 2019) will share tips and stories to unleash our inner rebel and sneak more creativity and imagination into our lives and work. Brand Evangelist, taking principles from theatre and weaving them into agile methodology inspiring millions of people (from around the world) to see collaboration and innovation as the secret sauce to making inspired software and brand campaigns. •	Co-Creator of the internationally viral women empowerment campaign #ItWasNeverADress. •	Started a scholarship for need-based students going into STEAM fields. •	Established strategic partnerships with community organizations, Fortune 500 companies and public figures.•	Utilized expertise in storytelling to craft compelling blog posts, copy, brand awareness campaigns and video scripts.•	Speech writing + coaching team members including engineers, developers and CEO. •	Spokesperson: addressing the press, giving interviews, and engaging audiences at innovation summits, tech companies, empowerment events, and more. •	Played key role in bringing siloed team members together to improve cross-functional relationships, communication and content company-wide•	Invited by The White House to attend the United State of Women Summit as a “Changemaker” for work around gender equity.
